intro: Ageratina spooneri, commonly known as the spoonleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its small, white or pale blue flower heads that are typically clustered in spherical inflorescences. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Ageratina spooneri is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and is used in gardens and landscapes for its visual appeal.
